The brandes of the regional variety recorded by black assume composers result from the application of a set of general principles or rules that alter pronunciation, morphology, syntax or lexicon. In the text, it is the result of the same rule to A) pronunciation of the words “Vorta” and “Vevé”. B) pronunciation of the words “Tarvez” and “Sorto”. C) verbal flexion found in “Furaó” and “Cantá”. D) redundancy in the “blind of the oio” and “kills in fró” expressions. E) pronunciation of the words “ignorance” and “avuá”.
